problem_text:
For a group G, let Dn(G) denote the n-th dimension subgroup of G, and ζn(G) the n-th term of its upper central series.
For a given integer n ⩾ 1, let f(n) = max{m | ∃a nilpotent group G of class n with Dm(G) ̸= 1} and g(n) = max{m | ∃a nilpotent group G of class n such that Dn(G) ̸⊆ ζm(G)}.
a) What is f(3)?
b) (B. I. Plotkin). Is it true that f(n) is finite for all n?
c) Is the growth of f(n) and g(n) polynomial, exponential, or intermediary?
It is known that both f(n) − n and g(n) tend to infinity as n → ∞ (N. Gupta, Yu. V. Kuz’min, J. Pure Appl. Algebra, 104 (1995), 191–197).
R. Mikhailov, I. B. S. Passi
